title: Charged rod near asymmetrical metal object

content.question: A negatively charged rod is brought near a metal object on an insulating stand, as shown above. When charges stop moving, the left side of the object has an excess of positive charge, and the right side of the object, where the radius of curvature is less, has an excess of negative charge. Which of the following best describes the electric potential on the metal object?

choices.label: It is greatest on the positively charged side of the object.
It is greatest on the negatively charged side of the object.
It is greatest at the center of the object.
It is the same everywhere on the object.
It cannot be determined from the information given.

content.answer: It is the same everywhere on the object.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
